Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Harris, as the first female Vice President of the United States, carries a first name that is rooted in her Indian cultural heritage passed down from her mother, Shyamala Gopalan.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Vice President of the United States
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Harris, as the first female Vice President of the United States, carries a first name that is rooted in her Indian cultural heritage passed down from her mother, Shyamala Gopalan.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Her name means “lotus flower,” and is pronounced “Comma-la.”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Vice President of the United States
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Her name means “lotus flower,” and is pronounced “Comma-la.”

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Former President Donald Trump, tech mogul Elon Musk, and several Republican leaders, including members of Congress and governors, repeatedly mispronounce her name.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Former President Donald Trump, tech mogul Elon Musk, and several Republican leaders, including members of Congress and governors, repeatedly mispronounce her name.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Bob Unanue, CEO of Goya Foods, even mocked her name by calling her ‘Que-mala,’ which means ‘so bad’” in Spanish.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Bob Unanue, CEO of Goya Foods, even mocked her name by calling her ‘Que-mala,’ which means ‘so bad’” in Spanish.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Harris explained that a name is a precious gift from one’s family, rooted in tradition, love, and hope.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Vice President of the United States
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Harris explained that a name is a precious gift from one’s family, rooted in tradition, love, and hope.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: She emphasized that respecting the significance of names honors those values, while mocking or mispronouncing them is childish and reflects a lack of maturity and respect.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Vice President of the United States
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: She emphasized that respecting the significance of names honors those values, while mocking or mispronouncing them is childish and reflects a lack of maturity and respect.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “That the highest elected leaders should conduct themselves like they did when they were children on the playground, it speaks poorly of their appreciation for the responsibility of the role that they have,” Harris said to Noah.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Vice President of the United States
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: “That the highest elected leaders should conduct themselves like they did when they were children on the playground, it speaks poorly of their appreciation for the responsibility of the role that they have,” Harris said to Noah.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “And I think it’s a reflection of their values and their maturity.”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Vice President of the United States
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: “And I think it’s a reflection of their values and their maturity.”

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “I don’t pay attention to the name-calling, Trevor. There’s some of us who have lived a lifetime of being called names. It is predictable, it is childish, and it will not distract me.”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Vice President of the United States
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: “I don’t pay attention to the name-calling, Trevor. There’s some of us who have lived a lifetime of being called names. It is predictable, it is childish, and it will not distract me.”
